Stats

Some cool stats stuff, still need to add.

combio.stats.acf_df(sequence: Union[Sequence, StimSequence, Iterable], resolution_ms: int = 1, smoothe_width: Union[int, float] = 0, smoothe_sd: Union[int, float] = 0)[source]

This function returns a Pandas DataFrame with timepoints and correlation factors.

combio.stats.acf_plot(sequence: Union[Sequence, StimSequence, Iterable], resolution_ms: int = 1, smoothe_width: Union[int, float] = 0, smoothe_sd: Union[int, float] = 0, style: str = 'seaborn', title: str = 'Autocorrelation', figsize: Optional[tuple] = None, suppress_display: bool = False)[source]

Based on Ravignani & Norton, 2017 Please provide a core.sequence.Sequence or core.stimsequence.StimSequence object, or an iterable containing stimulus onsets in milliseconds.

combio.stats.acf_values(sequence: Union[Sequence, StimSequence, Iterable], resolution_ms: int = 1, smoothe_width: Union[int, float] = 0, smoothe_sd: Union[int, float] = 0)[source]

From Ravignani & Norton, 2017

combio.stats.get_npvi(sequence: Union[Sequence, StimSequence, Iterable]) → float32[source]

Get nPVI

combio.stats.get_ugof(sequence: Union[Sequence, StimSequence, Iterable], theoretical_ioi: float, output: str = 'mean') → float32[source]

Credits to Lara. S. Burchardt, include ref.

combio.stats.ks_test(sequence: Union[Sequence, StimSequence, Iterable], reference_distribution: str = 'normal', alternative: str = 'two-sided')[source]

This function returns the D statistic and p value of a one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test. It calculates how different the supplied values are from a provided reference distribution.

If p is significant that means that the iois are not distributed according to the provided reference distribution.

References

Jadoul, Y., Ravignani, A., Thompson, B., Filippi, P. and de Boer, B. (2016). Seeking Temporal Predictability in Speech: Comparing Statistical Approaches on 18 World Languages’. Frontiers in Human Neuroscience, 10(586), 1–15.

Ravignani, A., & Norton, P. (2017). Measuring rhythmic complexity: A primer to quantify and compare temporal structure in speech, movement, and animal vocalizations. Journal of Language Evolution, 2(1), 4-19.
